A developed contingency plan was not available at the time of inspection. A complete written contingency helps facilities
prepare and plan for the humane care and handling of animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct September 27, 2024 by developing and maintaining a written emergency plan that is tailored to the facility and
provides for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of animals on hand in the event of an
emergency or disaster. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan. The plan must
also be reviewed annually, and any changes documented and maintained.

The facility is housing two red kangaroos in an outdoor enclosure which is not surrounded by a continuous 6-foot
perimeter fence that is distanced 3 feet away from the primary enclosure fence. The lack of an adequate perimeter fence
presents a safety risk to the animals because there is not an adequate secondary containment system to hold animals
that may escape their primary enclosures or a sufficient barrier to keep unauthorized animals and persons out.
Correct by November 17, 2024 by ensuring that the above listed animals being housed outdoors are enclosed by a 6-foot
perimeter fence that is distanced at least 3 feet from the primary enclosure or obtain a perimeter fencing variance from the
USDA Administrator.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
